pros: Possibility to grow, continuation, internal mobility, easy to move between departments
cons: not the best paid in the industry

review_title: Not Very Good for national employees
pros: Not Many Pros to be shared about working there except some Job growth, but it depends on who is your manager
cons: ACTED barely offers any benefits for employees who are under a national contract.

pros: Get additional per diem, housing, and education allowances
cons: Work/Life balance is tricky to manage

review_title: Poor Management - promoted by friendship and not skill or competency
pros: Entry to NGO field.  Opportunity to work in diverse countries.
cons:
below average salary range. Poor inexperienced management. A PD lady promoted to CD!! non technical expat GF of DCD put in charge of WASH project over WASH Engrs. crazy.  Poor experience leads to poor project management, waste of donor funding and sometimes poor beneficiary experience.
Senior management to keen on taking selfies on project site rather than ensuring camp fit for IDP's.  3 months in operation and no fire prevention measures contributed to death of a 2 year old. Management didn't care or want to know. move along, nothing to see.

pros: Great place to work, everyone is very friendly, professional and passionate about the NGO cause.
cons: There are no team building activities, understandable as this is a non-profit NGO.

pros: Good experience for fresh graduates or gaining NGOs experience, the salary rate is acceptable and good donors like UNHCR, OCHA
cons: No system, each department is independent, they don't care about the work quality nor quantity, no respect to working time hours

review_title: Great organization to get your foot in the door.
pros:
*Much more freedom to develop your own projects.
*Great people to work with.
*Good reputation in the industry.
cons:
*The salary is below average.
*Lack of support from Head Office.
*Workload can be very high sometimes
